dublinCore.dc:title: HR 255 ENR: Promoting Women in Entrepreneurship Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.congress: One Hundred Fifteenth Congress of the United States of America
form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Tuesday, the third day of January, two thousand and seventeen
form.official-title: To authorize the National Science Foundation to support entrepreneurial programs for women.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Promoting Women in Entrepreneurship Act.

paragraph.text: women make up almost 50 percent of the workforce, but less than 25 percent of the workforce in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) professions;
women are less likely to focus on the STEM disciplines in undergraduate and graduate study;
only 26 percent of women who do attain degrees in STEM fields work in STEM jobs;
there is an increasing demand for individuals with STEM degrees to extend their focus beyond the laboratory so they can be leaders in discovery commercialization;
studies have shown that technology and commercialization ventures are successful when women are in top management positions; and
the National Science Foundation’s mission includes supporting women in STEM disciplines.

section.text: Section 33 of the Science and Engineering Equal Opportunities Act (42 U.S.C. 1885a) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking and at the end of paragraph (10);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (11) and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
encourage its entrepreneurial programs to recruit and support women to extend their focus beyond the laboratory and into the commercial world.

attestation-group.role: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.
